title: CSS Text Styling
subject: CSS
theory:
CSS provides powerful tools to style text content.

*   `color`: Sets text color.
*   `text-align`: Horizontal alignment (left, right, center, justify).
*   `text-decoration`: Used for underlines, overlines, and removing link underlines.
*   `text-transform`: Controls capitalization (uppercase, lowercase, capitalize).
*   `line-height`: Sets the distance between lines of text.
*   `letter-spacing`: Increases/decreases space between characters.

common_mistakes.correction: `text-align: center` only centers text and inline elements. To center a div, use margin: auto.

interview_questions.question: How do you remove the underline from links?
What is the difference between `visibility: hidden` and `display: none`?
interview_questions.answer: Visibility: hidden hides text but keeps space. Display: none removes it from the flow entirely.

real_world_use_cases.description: Blogs use `line-height: 1.6` and `text-align: left` for optimal readability.

exam_notes: text-align: justify stretches lines to have equal width.
line-height can be unitless (multiplies font size).
summary: Typography is 90% of the web. Good text styling makes your site readable and professional.
